data.title: Where is the cast of Alien now? Actors still around 45 years after iconic movie's release
data.meta_description: As the beloved sci-fi movie Alien reels in its 45 year anniversary, we're catching up with where the talented cast are over four decades after the film's original premiere
data.text:
As the 1979 classic sci-fi movie Alien celebrates its 45-year anniversary, we're taking a look at where the star-studded cast is now four decades after the film's theatrical release.

The original Alien movie was a box-office success that captivated audiences everywhere, leading to a seven-movie franchise in the coming years. In the first film, a crew of the commercial starship Nostromo was navigating deep space from their cryo-sleep capsules halfway through their journey home to investigate a distress call from an alien vessel. But after the crew discovers a nest of eggs inside the alien ship, a organism from inside one of them jumps out and latches itself onto one of the crew members leading him to fall into a coma.

The gripping sci-fi movie directed by Ridley Scott has stood the test of time, becoming a household name and famous sci-fi classic. And as the movie celebrates this major milestone anniversary, we're checking in on where the talented crew are today including Hollywood stars Sigourney Weaver, Tom Skerritt, Veronica Cartwright, John Hurt, and Ian Holm.

Sigourney Weaver

Sigourney Weaver starred as the film and responsible character of Lieutenant First Class Ellen Ripley in Alien. In the movie, Ellen was a civilian adviser to the US Colonial Marine Corps and was one of the essential figures in the human encounters with the aliens. Ellen was known for often being right and asserting her authority while still remaining friendly. She was also the mother of Amanda and the ancestor of Alan Decker.

As her iconic role as Ellen, who was a character is regarded as a significant female protagonist in cinema history, Sigourney was honored with being voted as one of the 100 greatest movie stars of all time. During her run in Hollywood, Sigourney was a recipient of many awards and nominations including a British Academy Film Award, two Golden Globe Awards, and a Grammy Award, in addition to nominations for three Academy Awards, four Primetime Emmy Awards, and a Tony Award.

After shooting to stardom following her role as Ellen, Sigourney went on to star in a number of other famous films in the sci-fi genre. She is famously known for her roles in Ghostbusters, Avatar, The Cabin in the Woods, Annie Hall, Abduction, WALL-E, Holes, among many others. Sigourney is now 75 years old and in currently in talks to join the cast of the Star Wars film The Mandalorian & Grogu, according to reports from Variety.

Tom Skerritt

Tom Skerritt played the role of the captain and owner of the cargo vessel Arthur Dallas in Alien. His character was in command of the Nostromo during it's voyage in 2122 when it encountered the aliens, an incident that led to the destruction of the ship and the loss of everyone but one person of the human crew. Dallas was a generally laid-back captain and was known for making rushed, unwise choices under pressure and often avoided making tough decisions.

Since Alien, Tom has gone on to have a spectacular career starring in over 40 films and more than 200 TV episodes since he began acting in 1962. Some of Tom's most memorable performances outside of Alien include his roles in M*A*S*H, The Dead Zone, Top Gun, A River Runs Through It, Poltergeist III, and Up in Smoke, and the television series Picket Fences and Cheers. Tom is also the recipient of a number of nominations and awards, including winning the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series.

Tom is now 90 years old with his last performance being Dex in the 2021 Western action film Catch the Bullet. In recent years, Tom and his wife Julie Tokashiki have launched a digital media company known as Triple Squirrels Inc. and started their EVRGRN Channel.

Veronica Cartwright

Veronica Cartwright starred as the role of the navigator Joan Marie Lambert in the movie Alien. She was serving on the ship during its voyage in 2122 when it encountered a Xenomorph on LV-426, an incident that led to the destruction of the ship and the loss of all but one of its crew. Lambert was killed aboard the vessel while gathering oxygen tanks that would allow the survivors to flee.

Since her famous role in Alien, Veronica starred in over 26 horror and sci-fi movies over the years and is well-known for her roles in the hit television series ER and The X-Files. Some of her most well-known performances over the years include her appearance in The Witches of Eastwick, Invasion of the Body Snatchers, The Invasion, The Town That Dreaded Sundown, among many others. During her run in Hollywood, Veronica was nominated for three Primetime Emmy Awards.

Veronica is now 75 years old and still keeping busy guest starring in television shows. The famous actresses' last performance was as the role of the sinister grandmother Eunice Harmon in The CWâ€˜s series Gotham Knights.

John Hurt

John Hurt played the role of executive officer Thomas Kane in the movie Alien. Thomas was also serving on the ship during its voyage in 2122, when it encountered the aliens and died when the Chestburster erupted from his chest.

During his acting career that spanned over five decades, John starred in a number of famous films including Garrick Ollivander in the Harry Potter films, V for Vendetta, Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull, Outlander, Snowpiercer, Melancholia, and many more. Famous director David Lynch described him as "simply the greatest actor in the world" and was described as having the "most distinctive voice in Britain."

During his successful career, John was awarded the BAFTA Outstanding British Contribution to Cinema Award in 2012 and was knighted by Queen Elizabeth II in 2015 for his services to drama. John passed away in 2017 at the age of 77 years old at home three days after his birthday after a battle with pancreatic cancer.

Ian Holm

Ian Holm starred as the science officer Ash in the movie Alien. While those abroad the vessel thought Ash was a human, he was actually a Synthetic Sleeper Agent who was placed on the ship to ensure that the Xenomorph was returned to Weyland-Yutani.

Ian was also a British actor that starred in over 100 movies throughout his impressive career landing roles in many critically acclaimed films including The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, The Fifth Element, The Day After Tomorrow, The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey, Ratatouille, among many others. During his career he received numerous awards including two BAFTA Awards and a Tony Award, and nominations for an Academy Award. He was also made a Commander of the Order of the British Empire (CBE) in 1989 by Queen Elizabeth II.

Ian sadly passed away in died in June of 2020 in London at the age of 88 years old from illness related to Parkinson's Disease. The Hollywood star died peacefully in the hospital surrounded by his loved ones.
